content:
Add a Menu to a FlexCard

Create a menu from a list of actions on a FlexCard. Style the menu button, and each action in the menu's dropdown. Add any action type available in the FlexCard Designer.

From the FlexCard Designer, drag a Menu element into a state on the canvas.
(Optional) Update the element name in the Element Name field.
(Optional) In the Label field, enter the visible label of the menu button.
(Note) Beginning Summer '21, Label supports concatenated strings.

(Optional) Change the default menu button icon by entering the name of the icon or searching for one to select.
(Optional) Disable scrolling in the dropdown when there are more than 5 menu items, or change the position and size of the dropdown menu.

To add actions, click + Add New Action. Beginning Winter '22, you can also add conditions that must be met for each action to display.

To update the position of the action icon relative to the label, select a new position.
To enable menu items to reflect status level notifications like Error, Success, and Warning, select the class from the Status dropdown.

(Optional) Add conditions that must be met for the element to display, or style your menu element using the Style panel.

Beginning Summer '22, you can use your mouse and keyboard to open or close the menu and move through the menu items.
Preview your FlexCard. See Preview a FlexCard.
title: Adding Menus to FlexCards in OmniStudio
